docs.title: DOMController — Release Notes
docs.text:
Welcome to the DOMController documentation portal.

Find here all the information you need to follow the evolution of the system:

  • Versions — Complete release history with detailed changelogs
  • Features — Feature catalogue and the versions in which they are available
  • Known Issues — Known problems, workarounds and fix status

docs.title: Version 25.04 — December 2025 · API v32
docs.text:
LATEST

  • Improved DOMController performances when handling a large number of online devices
  • Credential size can now be specified to the system, with automatic padding and trimming handling
  • New API endpoints for configuring multiple OSS doors and devices at once
  • Log file size can be customized (duration and volume)

docs.title: Features
docs.text: Catalogue of all DOMController features, with the versions in which they are available.

docs.title: Access & Credentials
docs.text: Feature Description Versions Configurable credential size Credential size can be specified to the system with automatic padding and trimming handling 25.04 Hybrid card support Select which technology must be used for hybrid cards (global configuration) 25.01 OSS Creator Create OSS application data structure on a virgin Desfire transponder 23.10 OSS dynamic validity Set OSS dynamic validity in weeks, months or years 25.02 OSS custom key numbers Assign different key numbers when configuring OSS (out of standard) 25.02 Permissions per access group Assign permissions to access groups, each with its own opening delay 23.10 Special cards Emergency and Master Key tags on special cards 24.04 OSS Intervention mode Create OSS credentials with Intervention mode 24.04 OSS toggle mode (double tap) Transponder must be shown twice to switch to permanently open 23.10

docs.title: Doors & Devices
docs.text: Feature Description Versions Door abstraction Create a door without a coupled device and preconfigure it 25.03 Auto-coupling Automatic coupling of devices upon discovery 24.10 Factory reset Reset a controller to factory settings 24.07 Office function per permission Office function can be assigned to individual permissions 24.07 PackId global config PackId configuration defined globally at site level (override per door still available) 25.02 Multi-OSS door config New endpoint to configure several OSS doors at once 25.04 Multi-device config New endpoint to configure several device configurations at once 25.04 Per-device schedules Week/day schedules configurable per device instead of system-wide 25.02 OSS transponder read/write timeout Configurable read/write timeout for transponders via OSS Updater 25.02 Feature list per device List all available features per device with enabled/disabled flag 25.01 · 25.03 DOM Online Mesh support Official support for DOM Online Mesh products 25.02

docs.title: API & Connectivity
docs.text: Feature Description Versions Global multi-device orders Global route to send orders to several devices at once 25.01 OSS transponder last update time Last updated time of an OSS transponder available via API 25.04 · 25.03 API-based DOMController update Update DOMController via API instead of SSH (fallback mode) 25.02 WebSocket connection limit Limited to 10 simultaneous WebSocket connections, error 429 beyond 25.02 OSS events WebSocket Dedicated OSS event route and WebSocket 23.07 Certificate chain support Support for certificates with full authority certification chain 25.03 OS & packages version via API List OS version and main package versions through the API 25.01

docs.title: Synchronization & Schedules
docs.text: Feature Description Versions Fast Online Synchronization Reduce sync time from 15 min to 10 sec 23.03 Schedule isolation Changes only impact devices referring to the modified schedule 23.03 · 23.07 DOMService device filter Filter synchronized devices in DOM Service app 24.01 Wireless+ Report a transponder to the Access Control Server for access decision 23.10

docs.title: Backup & System
docs.text: Feature Description Versions Customizable log file size Log files' size configurable by duration and volume 25.04 Backup with permissions & OSS Optional permissions and OSS doors included in backups 24.10 Redis in backup Redis file included in backup (offline devices preserved after restore) 24.07 Device recovery system Recovery system to retrieve previously coupled lost devices 25.01 PHP 8 migration Migration from PHP 7 to PHP 8 24.10 DOMService OSS config & coupling Configure OSS and coupling directly from the DOMService App 24.01 OSS dynamic validity groups Dynamic validity groups in OSS Updater 23.03 OSS Updater New device for updating OSS transponders, managed by DOMBridge 22.12

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: Tracking of known problems, workarounds and fix status across versions.

docs.title: Active Issues
docs.text: No known active issues on the latest version (25.04).

docs.title: Resolved Issues
docs.text: Issue Affected Versions Fixed in Workaround DOMService synchronization sometimes stuck 24.07 24.10 In DOMPloy 12.0: click the Offline tab Online coupling stuck in "coupling" state 22.12 23.03 Open RFNM settings → "route devices" tab → submit again Battery replacement not always detected 23.07 23.10 No workaround available

docs.title: DOMService synchronization sometimes stuck
docs.text:
FIXED

Affected versions: 24.07 Fixed in: 24.10

Description: Synchronization with the DOMService application could randomly get stuck.

Workaround: A workaround is available in DOMPloy 12.0 by clicking on the "Offline" tab.

docs.title: Online coupling stuck in "coupling" state
docs.text:
FIXED

Affected versions: 22.12 Fixed in: 23.03

Description: Online coupling could sometimes get stuck indefinitely with the device remaining in "coupling" state.

Workaround: Open RFNM settings → go to the "route devices" tab → submit the configuration again.

docs.title: Battery replacement not always detected
docs.text:
FIXED

Affected versions: 23.07 Fixed in: 23.10

Description: Battery replacement was not always correctly detected and stored.

Workaround: No workaround available. Upgrading to version 23.10 is recommended.

docs.title: Versions
docs.text:
Full release history of the DOMController.

Version Date API Status 25.04 December 2025 v32 LATEST 25.03 October 2025 v31 25.02 June 2025 v30 25.01 April 2025 v29 24.10 October 2024 v28 24.07 July 2024 v27 24.04 April 2024 v26 24.01 January 2024 — 23.10 October 2023 — 23.07 July 2023 — 23.03 March 2023 — 22.12 December 2022 —

docs.title: Version XX.XX
docs.text: Month YYYY · API vXX

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Feature description.
  • Feature description.

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• Fix description.
  • Fix description.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: No known issues for this version.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Download v XX.XX — coming soon.

docs.title: Version 22.12
docs.text: December 2022

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Introducing the OSS Updater — a new device managed by the DOMBridge, allowing updating of OSS transponders. Requires implementing the new /api/oss routes.
  • Support for up to 4 templates instead of 2.

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• Online devices v1 are correctly managed again (update directly from a former version is now working).
  • Improved online coupling experience.
  • Significantly reduced the amount of data sent to devices (better performance and battery lifetime).
  • Extended delay in OSS configuration is now correctly applied on the device.
  • During a restore, an explicit error message is returned if the provided password is wrong.
  • Manual DNS setup is fixed.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text:
Online coupling can sometimes get stuck with a device staying in "coupling" state.

Workaround: Open RFNM settings, go to the "route devices" tab, then submit the configuration again.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 23.03
docs.text: March 2023

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• OSS Updater — introducing dynamic validity groups.
  • New Fast Online Synchronization parameter in the global configuration. This reduces synchronization time of online devices from 15 min to 10 sec. (Note: there could be an impact on battery lifetime depending on how optimized the Access Control Software implementation is.)
  • Separating OSS events read by OSS Updater into a second WebSocket.
  • Changes on Week Schedules will now only impact the devices referring to that Week Schedule, not others.

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• Pushing doorGroupIds as null in an OSS door will correctly result in the door belonging to no DoorGroups.
  • DomDeviceIsThere event is sent correctly again.
  • Reduced the chance of having incorrect BLE quality information on a device.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: No known issues for this version.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 23.07
docs.text: July 2023

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Added OSS event route and WebSocket.
  • Allows coupling devices directly from the DOM Service application.
  • Allows filtering the devices to synchronize with DOMBridge in the DOM Service application.
  • Changes on Day Schedules will now only impact the devices referring to that Day Schedule, not others.
  • Depending on the signed-in user, the application is no longer allowed to read events from devices.

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• Credentials in OSS Updater are no longer case-sensitive.
  • More special characters are now allowed in passwords for backup/restore.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: Battery replacement is not always correctly detected and stored.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 23.10
docs.text: October 2023

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Introducing OSS Creator. The OSS Updater can now be set as "creator", allowing to create the OSS application data structure on a virgin Desfire transponder.
  • Introducing Wireless+. Allows devices to report a transponder to the Access Control Server, which can then take the decision of granting access or not.
  • Permissions can now be assigned to access groups, each group defining its own opening delay.
  • Extended global configuration parameters.
  • New route to push several OSS permissions at once.
  • New OSS toggle mode: the transponder must be shown twice to switch to permanently open, instead of once.

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text: • Battery replacement was not always correctly detected and stored in the previous version — fixed.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: No known issues for this version.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 24.01
docs.text: January 2024

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Configuration of OSS and coupling directly from the DOMService App.
  • Configuration and permissions can now be pushed to new/coupling devices. When coupled, they will automatically apply these values.
  • Slightly improved OSS Updater performances (using the Skip Access option also improves performance when used as an Updater only, not combined with Access Manager).
  • Devices will no longer be synchronized if no value changes during an API call (better battery management).
  • Filter of synchronized devices in the DOM Service app.

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• The mute buzzer parameter is correctly set on the OSS Updater at coupling.
  • Global configuration values are correctly pushed during offline coupling.
  • Using OSS Creator mode, if the transponder was not correctly written the first time, it will now be recovered automatically.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: No known issues for this version.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 24.04
docs.text: April 2024 · API v26

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• New Emergency tag added to special cards.
  • New Master Key tag added to special cards.
  • Creating an OSS credential with Intervention mode.
  • OSS Creator supports EID (FW 5.9).
  • Access Mode is not available on offline devices.
  • The properties network-subnetmask and network-gateway are now included in getDevices with the with-details query parameter.

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• The "Battery Replace" OSS event will now be repeated every day for 1 week.
  • Unordered DoorgroupIds no longer trigger synchronization.
  • Changing a TPS name no longer triggers DOMBridge synchronization.
  • A bad update no longer crashes the NetManager.
  • Improvement of synchronization with the DOMService app (outbox-being-filled is now managed).
  • Restore on VM correctly restores the dombox ID.
  • DoorGroup can be deleted even if the OSS configuration is set on the device.
  • Manufacturer data is better managed during OSS import.
  • OSS name is now removed from the device when the OSS configuration is removed.
  • Special cards are now loaded correctly at startup.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: No known issues for this version.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 24.07
docs.text: July 2024 · API v27

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• It is now possible to factory reset a controller.
  • A new parameter has been added to ignore UID tags when OSS/EID is set.
  • Office function can now be assigned to single permissions.
  • The global performance of event collection has been improved.
  • The ACM default display LED is now BLUE instead of red (ACM Firmware 5.9).
  • The Redis file is now added to the backup of the controller so that offline devices are no longer missing after a restore.
  • A trace level has been added for the API logs.

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• It is now impossible to remove a device from a RFNM using the route-devices API route.
  • Devices will no longer be out-of-sync when a configuration change is sent but does not impact them directly.
  • Some requests are no longer bound to device state. If a device state is not correct to pull a request, the request will be stored and pushed when the state is ready.
  • The online configuration of RFNM/ACM is now up to date after changing IP settings.
  • The stability of coupling using the DOMService app has been improved.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text:
Synchronization with the DOMService app is sometimes stuck.

Workaround: A workaround is implemented in DOMPloy 12.0 by clicking on the Offline tab.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 24.10
docs.text: October 2024 · API v28

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Added an auto-coupling mode to the system, allowing automatic coupling of devices upon discovery.
  • When allowing auto-coupling to "low" BLE quality, the coupling is not immediate but delayed by 5 minutes to ensure selecting the best parent.
  • Migration from PHP 7 to PHP 8.
  • Optional permissions, schedules and OSS doors can now be saved in a backup.
  • Set-offline is now available even if the device is missing or syncing.

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• Full reprogramming is now directly applied on offline devices when triggered.
  • Updating the name or description of an OSS door no longer triggers any synchronization.
  • Fixed /api/oss/config route that could return an empty array instead of an empty object when no configuration was set.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: No known issues for this version.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 25.01
docs.text: April 2025 · API v29

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• The API offers a new global route which sends orders (remote open/close permanently) to several devices at once.
  • List all available features per device (note: the device must be coupled to have the full list).
  • List the OS version and main package versions through the API.
  • Added a recovery system that tries to get back previously coupled devices that are lost.
  • Supports hybrid cards by selecting which technology must be used (global configuration).

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• Toggle mode for OSS was reset to default when changing the configuration of an OSS door — fixed.
  • The limit parameter in the route /api/all-events was not interpreted if no page was given.
  • Decoupling an RFNM which has children devices now correctly returns a 400 Bad Request. A force parameter is added to override this protection.
  • Passing null values for summer and winter dates in /api/dombox/dstchanges will no longer trigger a warning in the response body.
  • Fixed an exception when calling /api/dombox/user/{username} with a user that has no permissions.
  • Apple Wallet is no longer triggered when presenting an iPhone on a device.
  • Returns the correct network configuration when using DHCP client on a DOMController Premium.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: No known issues for this version.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 25.02
docs.text: June 2025 · API v30

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Officially supports the new DOM Online Mesh products (please contact us for more details).
  • Week/day schedules can now be set per device instead of system-wide, allowing for more flexibility.
  • OSS dynamic validity can now be set in terms of weeks, months or years.
  • It is now possible to assign different key numbers when configuring OSS (out of the standard).
  • Using the OSS Updater, the timeout for transponder read/write is now configurable.
  • PackId configuration can be defined globally to the site (still possible to override it per door).
  • DOMController can be updated through the API instead of SSH (though it is longer and only for fallback).

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• Changing a user's password no longer deactivates the account.
  • Daylight Saving Time is now better managed when having more than 3 years of old dates.
  • Mobile keys based on OSS model can now be used with no actual OSS configuration in the doors.
  • When blacklisting an OSS transponder, it had one last access before the blacklist was actually pushed — fixed.
  • WebSocket connections are now limited to 10. An error 429 "Too Many Requests" is raised when trying to connect an 11th one.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: No known issues for this version.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 25.03
docs.text: October 2025 · API v31

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• New level of abstraction for Doors. One can now create a door without having a coupled device and preconfigure it. Once a device is assigned to the door, it will automatically receive its configuration. This allows for preparing the system before actually coupling the devices.
  • Features listed per device also embed a flag to specify if the feature is enabled or not.
  • Latest updated time for an OSS transponder is now saved in the credential and can be consulted via the API.
  • When resetting a DOMController, a new parameter allows not resetting its IP configuration.
  • Supports certificates with a full authority certification chain.

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• GET api/all-events request used to fail when both from and what parameters were used simultaneously.
  • When a Tapkey lock ID is missing, a full reprogramming will now collect it back correctly.
  • Schedules might be missing in ACM at coupling time — fixed.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: No known issues for this version.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.

docs.title: Version 25.04
docs.text: December 2025 · API v32 LATEST

docs.title: New Features
docs.text:
• Improved DOMController performances when handling a large number of online devices.
  • Credential size can now be specified to the system. The DOMController will handle padding and trimming for the permissions automatically.
  • New API endpoint allowing configuring several OSS doors at once.
  • New API endpoint allowing configuring several device configurations at once.
  • Last updated time of an OSS transponder is now available in the credential data.
  • Log files' size can be customized ([1–365] days, [1–1024] MB).

docs.title: Fixes
docs.text:
• Outdated summer periods are kept API-wise but are no longer synced to the devices.
  • RFNM and OSS Updater can now be correctly discovered via the DOM Service application.
  • Handles a known issue from MariaDB (versions 10.5.25, 10.6.18, 10.11.8, 11.0.6, 11.1.5, 11.2.4 and 11.4.2) on backup files.
  • Improves the update process of whitelisted transponders on OSS Updater.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: No known issues for this version.

docs.title: Download
docs.text: Installation file coming soon.
